pull.title: build: Post-pr23489 small cleanups
pull.body: This PR suggests small cleanups as follow ups of bitcoin/bitcoin#23489.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

issue.title: rpc: Pass const char* to evhttp_connection_get_peer for new libevent
issue.body:
The second parameter of evhttp_connection_get_peer in libevent already has type as `const char **`
The compilation of bitcoind with the fresh libevent occurs errors

Details: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/23606

issue.title: build: remove x-prefix's from comparisons
issue.body:
Very old shells suffered from bugs which meant that prefixing variables
with an "x" to ensure that the lefthand side of a comparison always
started with an alphanumeric character was needed. Modern shells don't
suffer from this issue (i.e Bash was fixed in 1996).

In any case, we've already got unprefixed checks used in our codebase, i.e 
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/681b25e3cd7d084f642693152322ed9a40f33ba0/configure.ac#L292
and have libs (in depends) that also use unprefixed comparisons in their
configure scripts.

I think it's time that we consolidate on not using the x-prefix workaround.
At best it's mostly just confusing. Could simplify some of these checks
further in future.

More info:
https://github.com/koalaman/shellcheck/wiki/SC2268
https://www.vidarholen.net/contents/blog/?p=1035

issue.title: build: Fix `make apk` for Android w/ non-default SOURCES_PATH in depends
issue.body:
On master (1488f55fa57a1400a57be837b574183f019c7855) if depends are built with the customized `SOURCES_PATH` variable, the following `make apk` fails for Android host (see bitcoin/bitcoin#22522).

Fixes bitcoin/bitcoin#22522.

I'm surprised `i686-linux-android` ABI is still supported. I would love to drop it but the variable renaming and PIC fix of this PR stand by themselves.

What is `i686-linux-android`? 32-bit x86 android? is that really a thing?

issue.title: build, qt: Drop support for i686-linux-android host
issue.body:
There are no reasons to keep support for `i686-linux-android` host, which is actually broken in master (50c502f54abd9eb15c8ddca013f0fdfae3d132a9), and this fact has been unnoticed for months :)

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23675#issuecomment-986206434:
> I'm surprised `i686-linux-android` ABI is still supported. I would love to drop it...

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23675#issuecomment-991340132
> What is `i686-linux-android`? 32-bit x86 android? is that really a thing?

build, refactor: Re-use `qt_lib_suffix` variable

tree 384e6dbdcc642bbba45f34ca934a7b4bc84aba7e
parent e5a81e65d74382a1c8803e5c85ce7f0e25611a8c
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1638657554 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1639325323 +0200

build, qt: Drop unused CROSS_COMPILE variable for Android builds

Since Qt 5.14.0 the CROSS_COMPILE variable always being overridden by
the Qt build system internally.

See upstream commit: c28b881c98fadcd3415370fad2525b558f6b03e4

events.message:
build, qt: Drop unused CROSS_COMPILE variable for Android builds

Since Qt 5.14.0 the CROSS_COMPILE variable always being overridden by
the Qt build system internally.

See upstream commit: c28b881c98fadcd3415370fad2525b558f6b03e4

verification.payload:
tree 9a520e581f2eea12a99fc991338ee0a5f82ce571
parent 3b8f4e347b09594dcf88f4f2c0bb5afc1265ef51
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1638657554 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1639325323 +0200

build: Use config_opts instead of passing a compiler flag directly

This approach is safer as it allows the configure script to check the
availability of a compiler flag.

events.message:

This approach is safer as it allows the configure script to check the
availability of a compiler flag.

rename.from: build: Fix build for i686-linux-android host and some small cleanups after pr23489

events.body:
ACK ef81c51f62e03cb53e65f1ced6120d87f1827c40

It would be good if going forward these changes could be consolidated a bit more. #23744 probably could have been done here (once we'd decided that direction), rather than a new PR, given this is still making Android related changes? Over the last week there's been lot of PRs doing Android related things:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23675
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23677
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23678
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23744
* https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/504

and by the looks there's at least one more to go:
> Dropped commits related to Android ABI as I'm going to implement them in a different way after #23744.

Every new build related PR means more Guix builds, and often rebuilds, as these kinds of changes have a tendency to conflict with each other. It can also just be hard to keep track of what's being changed and why, especially when PRs are opened, then changed to do something else, and then a different PR is opened doing something similar/related.

Guix Build:
```bash
dbad08c0e1d261a2b2099fd834b092fa232ec7ac890a560a07bb74a33003ec63  guix-build-ef81c51f62e0/output/aarch64-linux-gnu/SHA256SUMS.part
```

issue.title: build: Qt 5.15.2
issue.body:
> Opening this for visibility. Apart from it probably being time to use a newer version of Qt for releases, an update is required so that we are using a version which has a C++17 mode.
> 
> The biggest change here is that [Qt no longer has internal xcb libs](https://codereview.qt.nokia.com/c/qt/qtbase/+/253905), so we need to build the requirements ourselves.


Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19716
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23489

- build, qt: Ditch no_sdk_version_check.patch
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23618

- build: Post-pr23489 small cleanups
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23675

- build, qt, macOS: Don't hard-code x86_64 as the arch when using qmake 
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23583

issue.title: build: Qt 5.15.2
issue.body:
Cherrypicking because I broke the last one. Sorry.

> Opening this for visibility. Apart from it probably being time to use a newer version of Qt for releases, an update is required so that we are using a version which has a C++17 mode.
> 
> The biggest change here is that [Qt no longer has internal xcb libs](https://codereview.qt.nokia.com/c/qt/qtbase/+/253905), so we need to build the requirements ourselves.


Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19716
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23489

- build, qt: Ditch no_sdk_version_check.patch
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23618

- build: Post-pr23489 small cleanups
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23675

- build, qt, macOS: Don't hard-code x86_64 as the arch when using qmake 
Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23583
